      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Double bloodGlucoseGoalCalculation(java.lang.Double bloodGlucoseLevel)
      To calculate how much insulin to take, to get the blood glucose level back to "normal" we take the current blood glucose level, subtract it from the target glucose level and divide it by the insulin sensitivity
      Food calculateNutritinalValuesDependingOnWeight(android.util.Pair<Food,java.lang.Double> pair)
      Converts the nutritional values of a Food object so it corresponds with the amount selected
      java.lang.Double fiberPercentage(java.lang.Double carbohydrate, java.lang.Double fiber)
      To calculate the percentage of fibers in the carbohydrates, we take the amount of fiber divided by the total amount of carbohydrate divided by 100
      java.lang.Double insulinCalculator(java.lang.Double carbohydrate, java.lang.Double bloodGlucoseLevel)
      To calculate how much insulin to take based on the carbohydrate consumption we divide the carbohydrate by the carbohydrate relation and account for the current blood glucose level.
      java.lang.Double sugarPercentage(java.lang.Double carbohydrate, java.lang.Double sugar)
      To calculate the percentage of sugar in the carbohydrates, we take the amount of sugar divided by the total amount of carbohydrate divided by 100

    • Method Detail

      • bloodGlucoseGoalCalculation

        public java.lang.Double bloodGlucoseGoalCalculation(java.lang.Double bloodGlucoseLevel)
        To calculate how much insulin to take, to get the blood glucose level back to "normal" we take the current blood glucose level, subtract it from the target glucose level and divide it by the insulin sensitivity
        Parameters:
        bloodGlucoseLevel - Double representing the measured blood glucose level
        Returns:
        Double representing the amount of insulin needed to adjust blood glucose level

      • insulinCalculator

        public java.lang.Double insulinCalculator(java.lang.Double carbohydrate,
                                          java.lang.Double bloodGlucoseLevel)
        To calculate how much insulin to take based on the carbohydrate consumption we divide the carbohydrate by the carbohydrate relation and account for the current blood glucose level.
        Parameters:
        carbohydrate - Double representing the amount of carbohydrate
        bloodGlucoseLevel - Double representing the measured blood glucose level
        Returns:
        Double representing the amount of insulin needed to account for the carbohydrates and adjust of blood glucose level

      • fiberPercentage

        public java.lang.Double fiberPercentage(java.lang.Double carbohydrate,
                                        java.lang.Double fiber)
        To calculate the percentage of fibers in the carbohydrates, we take the amount of fiber divided by the total amount of carbohydrate divided by 100
        Parameters:
        carbohydrate - Double representing the amount of carbohydrate
        fiber - Double representing the amount of fiber
        Returns:
        Double representing the amount of carbohydrate that is fiber in percentages

      • sugarPercentage

        public java.lang.Double sugarPercentage(java.lang.Double carbohydrate,
                                        java.lang.Double sugar)
        To calculate the percentage of sugar in the carbohydrates, we take the amount of sugar divided by the total amount of carbohydrate divided by 100
        Parameters:
        carbohydrate - Double representing the amount of carbohydrate
        sugar - Double representing the amount of sugar
        Returns:
        Double representing the amount of carbohydrate that is sugar in percentages

      • calculateNutritinalValuesDependingOnWeight

        public Food calculateNutritinalValuesDependingOnWeight(android.util.Pair<Food,java.lang.Double> pair)
        Converts the nutritional values of a Food object so it corresponds with the amount selected
        Parameters:
        pair - A pair consisting of the Food object and the amount
        Returns:
        A adjusted Food object
